The first 20 hours, how to learn anything by Josh Kaufman[1]
4 Chords by The Axis Of Awesome[2]
How to become a Jack of all trades and Master of Some by Nicholas Grundy[3]
Being a Renaissance Person in the 21st Century by Randy LaFoy[4]
Paths to Polymathy | Ben Vandgrift[5]
Why Some of us Don't Have One True Calling | Emilie Wapnick[6]
What is a Polymath?[7]
Polymaths Have Difficult Career Choices[8]
How and Why to Start A Startup - Sam Altman & Dustin Moskovitz[9]
Who are the Renaissance men and women today? | Haig Armen[10]
All power to the polymath, Ella Saltmarshe[11]
Astra Taylor on the Unschooled Life[12]
Can anyone become a genius | Mark Diaz[13]
The Rise of the Generalist | Tim Piazza[14]
Polymath Introductions[15]
Polymath, A Definition[16]
Millennial polymathy, Mili Ghosh[17]
How To Become A Modern Polymath[18]
Channeling Your Inner Renaissance | Sriharshita "Harshu" Musunuri[19]
Pink Da Vinci[20]
Leonardo DaVinci[21]
Ben & Me (1953)[22]
Benjamin Franklin, 7 Interesting Facts from the Biography of the American Polymath[23]
Mr Rogers Plays The Glass Armonica![24]
Adagio for Glass Harmonica, K 356, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791) - Ben's Glass Armonica[25]
Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy on the Glass Armonica[26]
The Last Transit of Venus on the Glass Armonica[27]
Mae Jemison, I Wanted To Go Into Space[28]
The world needs all kinds of minds | Temple Grandin[29]
What’s wrong with being a “Jack-of-All-Trades”? | John Halpin[30]

QUOTE BY MILI GHOSH

> Find Nemo!
> 
> Mili Ghosh[31]
